name: Coel

attributes.attribute: euhemerized or diminished into a mere human

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: British god Coel (also known as Coel Hen) is often mentioned in the popular nursery rhyme "Old King Cole was a merry old soul." However, it's important to note that Coel was never actually a king, but rather an ancient Celtic deity known as "old Coel," who over time was demoted or discredited to the status of a human being. Despite this, his name persisted and is seen in the town of Colchester.
